information:
The middleweight bout between Joe Pyfer and Kelvin Gastelum is scheduled for the main card of UFC 316, which will take place on June 7, 2025, at the Prudential Center in Newark, New Jersey. This is a rebooked fight, originally scheduled for UFC Mexico on March 29 before being cancelled. According to UFCStats 'tale of the tape' data, Pyfer has a slight grappling and reach advantage, while Gastelum fights from a southpaw stance.

Joe Pyfer has won six of his last seven professional fights, holding a 4-1 record within the UFC. His most recent victory was a first-round knockout of Marc-Andre Barriault at UFC 303, which earned him a Performance of the Night bonus. Pyfer had to withdraw from the originally scheduled fight against Gastelum in Mexico due to an illness.

Kelvin Gastelum is a veteran fighter and the winner of 'The Ultimate Fighter 17'. The fight at UFC 316 will mark his 24th appearance in the UFC Octagon. He has won two of his last three fights, with his most recent competition being a unanimous decision victory over Daniel Rodriguez in June 2024 at UFC Saudi Arabia.

forecast.status_quo_outcome: Joe Pyfer fights Kelvin Gastelum as scheduled at UFC 316 on June 7, 2025
forecast.no_outcome_scenario: Pyfer withdraws from UFC 316 due to injury or illness (as he did for the Mexico event), or he fights Gastelum but loses the bout via decision, knockout, or submission
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: Pyfer fights Gastelum as scheduled and defeats him via knockout, submission, or decision, continuing his strong recent form that includes a first-round KO win at UFC 303
forecast.rationale: The fight is confirmed and scheduled in 12 days, making cancellation relatively unlikely though not impossible given Pyfer's recent withdrawal from the Mexico event due to illness. However, that was 2 months ago, providing adequate recovery time. The key question is whether Pyfer wins if the fight occurs. Pyfer's recent form is strong: 6-of-7 wins overall and 4-1 in the UFC, with his most recent victory being a first-round KO that earned a Performance bonus. He appears to be on an upward trajectory with knockout power. Gastelum is a veteran with 24 UFC appearances but is coming off nearly a year-long layoff since his June 2024 win. The tale of the tape slightly favors Pyfer in grappling and reach. Based on recent form and momentum, Pyfer likely enters as a modest favorite. I estimate approximately 92% chance the fight happens as scheduled, and if it does, roughly 60% chance Pyfer wins, yielding a combined probability around 55%. This forecast isn't higher because Gastelum's veteran experience and the inherent unpredictability of MMA create significant uncertainty, and there remains some withdrawal risk. It isn't lower because Pyfer's momentum, knockout power, and recent success suggest he has a legitimate edge in this matchup. I would update higher with evidence of Pyfer being a clear betting favorite or signs of Gastelum decline, and lower if injury/illness concerns emerge for Pyfer or scheduling issues arise.

prompt:
You are a professional forecaster interviewing for a job.

Your interview question is:
Will Joe Pyfer defeat someone at UFC 316?

Question background:
Sports Illustrated: [UFC 316 adds rebooked fight after last-minute Mexico cancellation](https://www.si.com/fannation/mma/news/ufc-316-rebooked-fight-kelvin-gastelum-joe-pyfer-mexico-cancellation)


This question's outcome will be determined by the specific criteria below. These criteria have not yet been satisfied:
This question resolves as **Yes** if Joe Pyfer defeats someone at [UFC 316](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UFC_316).

If Pyfer does not fight anyone at UFC 316, this resolves as No.


Your research assistant's report says:
The middleweight bout between Joe Pyfer and Kelvin Gastelum is scheduled for the main card of UFC 316, which will take place on June 7, 2025, at the Prudential Center in Newark, New Jersey. This is a rebooked fight, originally scheduled for UFC Mexico on March 29 before being cancelled. According to UFCStats 'tale of the tape' data, Pyfer has a slight grappling and reach advantage, while Gastelum fights from a southpaw stance.

Joe Pyfer has won six of his last seven professional fights, holding a 4-1 record within the UFC. His most recent victory was a first-round knockout of Marc-Andre Barriault at UFC 303, which earned him a Performance of the Night bonus. Pyfer had to withdraw from the originally scheduled fight against Gastelum in Mexico due to an illness.

Kelvin Gastelum is a veteran fighter and the winner of 'The Ultimate Fighter 17'. The fight at UFC 316 will mark his 24th appearance in the UFC Octagon. He has won two of his last three fights, with his most recent competition being a unanimous decision victory over Daniel Rodriguez in June 2024 at UFC Saudi Arabia.

Today is 2025-05-26.

Before answering you think:
(a) The time left until the outcome to the question is known.
(b) The status quo outcome if nothing changed.
(c) A brief description of a scenario that results in a No outcome.
(d) A brief description of a scenario that results in a Yes outcome.
(e) You write your rationale remembering that good forecasters put extra weight on the status quo outcome since the world changes slowly most of the time. Explain your reasoning and the evidence behind your forecast in detail. Summarise information your received from your research assistant that influences your forecast (if any). Explain why your forecast is not higher, and why it is not lower. Outline what would need to be true for you to update your forecast in either direction.
(f) The last thing you write is your final probabilistic forecast as a number between 0 and 100.

# OUTPUT SCHEMA
{
    "time_left_until_outcome_known": "string",
    "status_quo_outcome": "string",
    "no_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "yes_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "rationale": "string",
    "probability": "number" (0-100)
}
